title: [false-positive] Param incorrectly marked as unused
body:
Apologies for not including a psalm.dev link here, I tried a few things but wasn't able to create a self-contained repro of the issue, it *does* however occur on latest master (at time of reporting: 7ded79bb2). I figured it might be best to just file this anyway rather than leaving  the issue unreportedâ€”I'll keep trying on finding a minimal PoC and update this if I track down what causes this.

The issue is reproducible locally and [in travis](https://travis-ci.org/erusev/parsedown/jobs/563657541#L569-L581), and is as follows:

```
$ vendor/bin/psalm --find-dead-code

ERROR: PossiblyUnusedParam - src/Parsedown.php:84:55 - Param #2 is never referenced in this method
    public static function blocks(Lines $Lines, State $State)


------------------------------
1 errors found
------------------------------

Checks took 1.12 seconds and used 153.612MB of memory
Psalm was able to infer types for 99.7719% of the codebase
Script vendor/bin/psalm --find-dead-code handling the test-dead-code event returned with error code 1
```

and the method in question looks like:

```php
    /**
     * @return array{Block[], State}
     */
    public static function blocks(Lines $Lines, State $State)
    {
        $RecursionLimiter = $State->get(RecursionLimiter::class)->increment();

        if ($RecursionLimiter->isDepthExceeded()) {
            $State = $State->setting(new BlockTypes([], []));
        }

        $State = $State->setting($RecursionLimiter);

        // ...
```

where clearly, param 2 (`$State`) has in-fact been used.

You can obtain a copy of the affected codebase by running:

```bash
git clone https://github.com/erusev/parsedown \
  && cd parsedown \
  && git checkout 18ee4ff \
  && composer install
```

and reproduce the issue with:

```bash
vendor/bin/psalm --find-dead-code
```
